```diff
  {{ $allPosts := where (where .Site.RegularPages &quot;Type&quot; &quot;posts&quot;) &quot;Draft&quot; false }}
  {{ $posts := sort $allPosts &quot;Date&quot; &quot;desc&quot; }}
+ {{ $postsPerPage := 9 }}
+ {{ $currentPage := 1 }}
+ {{ if .Params.page }}
+     {{ $currentPage = int .Params.page }}
+ {{ end }}
+ {{ $totalPosts := len $posts }}
+ {{ $totalPages := div (add $totalPosts (sub $postsPerPage 1)) $postsPerPage }}
+ {{ $startIndex := add (mul (sub $currentPage 1) $postsPerPage) 4 }}
+ {{ $endIndex := add $startIndex $postsPerPage }}
+ {{ $recentPosts := after 4 $posts | first (sub $endIndex 4) }}
+ {{ if gt $currentPage 1 }}
+     {{ $skipCount := add (mul (sub $currentPage 1) $postsPerPage) 4 }}
+     {{ $recentPosts = after $skipCount $posts | first $postsPerPage }}
+ {{ end }}
```

```diff
+                         {{ if eq $pageNum $currentPage }}
+                             &lt;span class=&quot;pagination-number pagination-current&quot;&gt;{{ $pageNum }}&lt;/span&gt;

+                         {{ else if or (eq $pageNum (add $delta 2)) (eq $pageNum (sub $totalArticlePages (add $delta 1))) }}
```

Switching to server-side pagination with Hugo. Updating the template to use Hugo's pagination:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: themes/majority/layouts/_default/home.html</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 14, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -11,4 +11,18 @@
  {{ $allPosts := where (where .Site.RegularPages &quot;Type&quot; &quot;posts&quot;) &quot;Draft&quot; false }}
  {{ $posts := sort $allPosts &quot;Date&quot; &quot;desc&quot; }}
+ {{ $remainingPosts := after 4 $posts }}
+ {{ $articlesPerPage := 9 }}
+ {{ $currentPage := 1 }}
+ {{ if .Paginator }}
+     {{ $currentPage = .Paginator.PageNumber }}
+ {{ end }}
+ {{ $totalArticles := len $remainingPosts }}
+ {{ $totalPages := div (add $totalArticles (sub $articlesPerPage 1)) $articlesPerPage }}
+ {{ $startIndex := mul (sub $currentPage 1) $articlesPerPage }}
+ {{ $paginatedPosts := $remainingPosts | first $articlesPerPage }}
+ {{ if gt $currentPage 1 }}
+     {{ $skipCount := mul (sub $currentPage 1) $articlesPerPage }}
+     {{ $paginatedPosts = after $skipCount $remainingPosts | first $articlesPerPage }}
+ {{ end }}
  &lt;div class=&quot;recent-posts&quot;&gt;
      &lt;div class=&quot;container&quot;&gt;
```

**Chunk 2**

```diff
-                 &lt;article class=&quot;recent-article-card&quot; data-page=&quot;{{ . }}&quot;&gt;

                          {{ if .Params.featuredImage }}
```

Creating the JavaScript file for pagination:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: themes/majority/static/js/pagination.js</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 151, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,151 @@
- 
+ (function() {
+     &#39;use strict&#39;;
+     
+     function initPagination() {
+         const paginationEl = document.getElementById(&#39;articles-pagination&#39;);
+         const articlesGrid = document.getElementById(&#39;articles-grid&#39;);
+         
+         if (!paginationEl || !articlesGrid) {
+             return;
+         }
+         
+         const totalPages = parseInt(paginationEl.getAttribute(&#39;data-total-pages&#39;), 10);
+         const perPage = parseInt(paginationEl.getAttribute(&#39;data-per-page&#39;), 10);
+         const articles = Array.from(articlesGrid.querySelectorAll(&#39;.recent-article-card&#39;));
+         const prevBtn = document.getElementById(&#39;pagination-prev&#39;);
+         const nextBtn = document.getElementById(&#39;pagination-next&#39;);
+         const numbersContainer = document.getElementById(&#39;pagination-numbers&#39;);
+         
+         let currentPage = 1;
+         
+         // Get page from URL hash or default to 1
+         const hashMatch = window.location.hash.match(/page-(\d+)/);
+         if (hashMatch) {
+             currentPage = parseInt(hashMatch[1], 10);
+             if (currentPage &lt; 1 || currentPage &gt; totalPages) {
+                 currentPage = 1;
+             }
+         }
+         
+         function showPage(page) {
+             currentPage = page;
+             
+             // Hide all articles
+             articles.forEach((article, index) =&gt; {
+                 const pageNum = Math.floor(index / perPage) + 1;
+                 if (pageNum === page) {
+                     article.style.display = &#39;&#39;;
+                 } else {
+                     article.style.display = &#39;none&#39;;
+                 }
+             });
+             
+             // Update pagination UI
+             updatePaginationUI();
+             
+             // Update URL hash without scrolling
+             window.history.replaceState(null, &#39;&#39;, window.location.pathname + &#39;#page-&#39; + page);
+             
+             // Scroll to articles section
+             const articlesBox = articlesGrid.closest(&#39;.recent-articles-box&#39;);
+             if (articlesBox) {
+                 articlesBox.scrollIntoView({ behavior: &#39;smooth&#39;, block: &#39;start&#39; });
+             }
+         }
+         
+         function updatePaginationUI() {
+             // Update prev/next buttons
+             if (currentPage === 1) {
+                 prevBtn.classList.add(&#39;pagination-disabled&#39;);
+                 prevBtn.style.pointerEvents = &#39;none&#39;;
+             } else {
+                 prevBtn.classList.remove(&#39;pagination-disabled&#39;);
+                 prevBtn.style.pointerEvents = &#39;&#39;;
+             }
+             
+             if (currentPage === totalPages) {
+                 nextBtn.classList.add(&#39;pagination-disabled&#39;);
+                 nextBtn.style.pointerEvents = &#39;none&#39;;
+             } else {
+                 nextBtn.classList.remove(&#39;pagination-disabled&#39;);
+                 nextBtn.style.pointerEvents = &#39;&#39;;
+             }
+             
+             // Generate page numbers
+             numbersContainer.innerHTML = &#39;&#39;;
+             const delta = 2;
+             
+             for (let pageNum = 1; pageNum &lt;= totalPages; pageNum++) {
+                 const shouldShow = 
+                     pageNum &lt;= delta + 1 ||
+                     (pageNum &gt;= currentPage - delta &amp;&amp; pageNum &lt;= currentPage + delta) ||
+                     pageNum &gt;= totalPages - delta;
+                 
+                 if (shouldShow) {
+                     if (pageNum === currentPage) {
+                         const span = document.createElement(&#39;span&#39;);
+                         span.className = &#39;pagination-number pagination-current&#39;;
+                         span.textContent = pageNum;
+                         numbersContainer.appendChild(span);
+                     } else if (
+                         pageNum === 1 ||
+                         pageNum === totalPages ||
+                         (pageNum &gt; currentPage - delta &amp;&amp; pageNum &lt; currentPage + delta)
+                     ) {
+                         const link = document.createElement(&#39;a&#39;);
+                         link.className = &#39;pagination-number&#39;;
+                         link.href = &#39;#page-&#39; + pageNum;
+                         link.textContent = pageNum;
+                         link.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, function(e) {
+                             e.preventDefault();
+                             showPage(pageNum);
+                         });
+                         numbersContainer.appendChild(link);
+                     } else if (pageNum === delta + 2 || pageNum === totalPages - delta - 1) {
+                         const ellipsis = document.createElement(&#39;span&#39;);
+                         ellipsis.className = &#39;pagination-ellipsis&#39;;
+                         ellipsis.textContent = &#39;...&#39;;
+                         numbersContainer.appendChild(ellipsis);
+                     }
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         
+         // Event listeners
+         prevBtn.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, function(e) {
+             e.preventDefault();
+             if (currentPage &gt; 1) {
+                 showPage(currentPage - 1);
+             }
+         });
+         
+         nextBtn.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, function(e) {
+             e.preventDefault();
+             if (currentPage &lt; totalPages) {
+                 showPage(currentPage + 1);
+             }
+         });
+         
+         // Handle hash changes
+         window.addEventListener(&#39;hashchange&#39;, function() {
+             const hashMatch = window.location.hash.match(/page-(\d+)/);
+             if (hashMatch) {
+                 const page = parseInt(hashMatch[1], 10);
+                 if (page &gt;= 1 &amp;&amp; page &lt;= totalPages) {
+                     showPage(page);
+                 }
+             }
+         });
+         
+         // Initialize
+         showPage(currentPage);
+     }
+     
+     // Initialize when DOM is ready
+     if (document.readyState === &#39;loading&#39;) {
+         document.addEventListener(&#39;DOMContentLoaded&#39;, initPagination);
+     } else {
+         initPagination();
+     }
+ })();
+ 
```

</details>

---


## Summary

1. **Updated the home page template** (`themes/majority/layouts/_default/home.html`):
   - Added pagination structure at the bottom of the articles section
   - All articles are rendered in the HTML (SEO-friendly)
   - Pagination controls are added when there's more than one page

2. **Added pagination CSS** (`themes/majority/static/css/style.css`):
   - Styles for pagination numbers, current page indicator, ellipsis, and disabled states
   - Responsive design maintained

3. **Created pagination JavaScript** (`themes/majority/static/js/pagination.js`):
   - Client-side pagination (9 articles per page after the first 4 featured posts)
   - URL hash updates for bookmarking/sharing (e.g., `#page-2`)
   - Smooth scrolling to the articles section on page change
   - Page numbers with ellipsis for large page counts
   - Previous/Next navigation

4. **Added script to base template** (`themes/majority/layouts/_default/baseof.html`):
   - Pagination script loads only on the home page

The pagination appears at the bottom of the articles section on the home page. It shows 9 articles per page (after the first 4 featured posts) and includes Previous/Next buttons and page numbers. All articles remain in the HTML for SEO, and JavaScript handles the pagination display.

To test, rebuild your Hugo site and check the home page. The pagination should appear when there are more than 9 articles (13+ total posts).

Creating a PowerShell script to list articles by date for easier deletion:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: list-articles-by-date.ps1</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 80, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,80 @@
- 
+ # List all articles sorted by date (oldest first)
+ # This helps identify early articles for deletion
+ 
+ $contentPath = &quot;content\posts&quot;
+ $articles = @()
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;Scanning articles in $contentPath...&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ 
+ Get-ChildItem -Path $contentPath -Filter &quot;*.md&quot; | ForEach-Object {
+     $file = $_
+     $content = Get-Content $file.FullName -Raw
+     
+     # Extract date from front matter
+     if ($content -match &#39;(?s)\+\+\+.*?date\s*=\s*(\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})&#39;) {
+         $dateStr = $matches[1]
+         $date = [DateTime]::ParseExact($dateStr, &quot;yyyy-MM-dd&quot;, $null)
+         
+         # Extract title
+         $title = &quot;Untitled&quot;
+         if ($content -match &#39;title\s*=\s*&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;&#39;) {
+             $title = $matches[1]
+         } elseif ($content -match &quot;title\s*=\s*&#39;([^&#39;]+)&#39;&quot;) {
+             $title = $matches[1]
+         }
+         
+         # Extract draft status
+         $isDraft = $false
+         if ($content -match &#39;draft\s*=\s*(true|false)&#39;) {
+             $isDraft = $matches[1] -eq &quot;true&quot;
+         }
+         
+         $articles += [PSCustomObject]@{
+             Date = $date
+             DateString = $dateStr
+             Title = $title
+             FileName = $file.Name
+             FilePath = $file.FullName
+             IsDraft = $isDraft
+         }
+     } else {
+         Write-Warning &quot;Could not parse date from: $($file.Name)&quot;
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ # Sort by date (oldest first)
+ $sortedArticles = $articles | Sort-Object Date
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;n========================================&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ Write-Host &quot;Articles by Date (Oldest First)&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ Write-Host &quot;========================================&#96;n&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ 
+ $count = 0
+ foreach ($article in $sortedArticles) {
+     $count++
+     $draftStatus = if ($article.IsDraft) { &quot; [DRAFT]&quot; } else { &quot;&quot; }
+     $color = if ($article.IsDraft) { &quot;DarkGray&quot; } else { &quot;White&quot; }
+     
+     Write-Host &quot;$count. &quot; -NoNewline -ForegroundColor Yellow
+     Write-Host &quot;$($article.DateString) &quot; -NoNewline -ForegroundColor Cyan
+     Write-Host &quot;- &quot; -NoNewline
+     Write-Host &quot;$($article.Title)$draftStatus&quot; -ForegroundColor $color
+     Write-Host &quot;   File: &quot; -NoNewline -ForegroundColor DarkGray
+     Write-Host &quot;$($article.FileName)&quot; -ForegroundColor DarkGray
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;n========================================&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ Write-Host &quot;Summary&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ Write-Host &quot;========================================&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ Write-Host &quot;Total Articles: $($sortedArticles.Count)&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ Write-Host &quot;Draft Articles: $(($sortedArticles | Where-Object { $_.IsDraft }).Count)&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ Write-Host &quot;Published Articles: $(($sortedArticles | Where-Object { -not $_.IsDraft }).Count)&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ 
+ if ($sortedArticles.Count -gt 0) {
+     Write-Host &quot;&#96;nOldest Article: $($sortedArticles[0].DateString) - $($sortedArticles[0].Title)&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+     Write-Host &quot;Newest Article: $($sortedArticles[-1].DateString) - $($sortedArticles[-1].Title)&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;nTo delete an article, remove the file:&quot; -ForegroundColor Magenta
+ Write-Host &quot;  Remove-Item &#39;content\posts\&lt;filename&gt;&#39;&quot; -ForegroundColor DarkGray
+ 
```

---


Created two ways to view articles by date:

## 1. Web page (browser)

A page at `/articles-by-date/` lists all articles sorted by date (oldest first). It shows:
- Article title and date
- File path for each article
- Summary statistics

Rebuild your Hugo site and visit `/articles-by-date/` to view it.

## 2. PowerShell script (terminal)

A script `list-articles-by-date.ps1` lists articles in the terminal with file paths.

To use it:
1. Open PowerShell in your project directory
2. Run: `.\list-articles-by-date.ps1`

It will show:
- All articles sorted by date (oldest first)
- File names for easy deletion
- Draft status
- Summary statistics

The script is useful for bulk deletion since it shows exact file paths.

Should I also create a script to delete articles by date range (e.g., all articles before a certain date)?

---

_**User (2025-12-01 22:47Z)**_

I want to be able to mark them for deletion

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_



---


Adding a way to mark articles for deletion. Creating scripts to mark/unmark articles and updating the listing to show which are marked.


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: mark-article-for-deletion.ps1</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 156, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,156 @@
- 
+ # Mark articles for deletion by adding a &quot;deleted: true&quot; field to front matter
+ # Usage: .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -FileName &quot;article-name.md&quot;
+ #        .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -DateBefore &quot;2021-01-01&quot;
+ #        .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -DateRange &quot;2020-01-01&quot; &quot;2020-12-31&quot;
+ 
+ param(
+     [string]$FileName,
+     [string]$DateBefore,
+     [string]$DateFrom,
+     [string]$DateTo,
+     [switch]$Unmark,
+     [switch]$ListMarked
+ )
+ 
+ $contentPath = &quot;content\posts&quot;
+ 
+ function MarkArticle($filePath, $markAsDeleted) {
+     $content = Get-Content $filePath -Raw -Encoding UTF8
+     
+     if ($markAsDeleted) {
+         # Check if already marked
+         if ($content -match &#39;deleted\s*=\s*true&#39;) {
+             Write-Host &quot;Already marked: $($filePath | Split-Path -Leaf)&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+             return $false
+         }
+         
+         # Add deleted: true after draft field or at the end of front matter
+         if ($content -match &#39;(?s)(\+\+\+.*?)(draft\s*=\s*[^\r\n]+)&#39;) {
+             $newContent = $content -replace &#39;(?s)(\+\+\+.*?)(draft\s*=\s*[^\r\n]+)&#39;, &quot;&#96;$1&#96;$2&#96;r&#96;ndeleted = true&quot;
+         } elseif ($content -match &#39;(?s)(\+\+\+.*?)(\+\+\+)&#39;) {
+             # Add before closing +++
+             $newContent = $content -replace &#39;(?s)(\+\+\+.*?)(\+\+\+)&#39;, &quot;&#96;$1deleted = true&#96;r&#96;n&#96;$2&quot;
+         } else {
+             Write-Warning &quot;Could not parse front matter in: $filePath&quot;
+             return $false
+         }
+         
+         Set-Content -Path $filePath -Value $newContent -Encoding UTF8 -NoNewline
+         Write-Host &quot;Marked for deletion: $($filePath | Split-Path -Leaf)&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+         return $true
+     } else {
+         # Unmark - remove deleted field
+         if ($content -match &#39;deleted\s*=\s*true&#39;) {
+             $newContent = $content -replace &#39;(?s)\r?\ndeleted\s*=\s*true\r?\n&#39;, &quot;&#96;r&#96;n&quot;
+             $newContent = $newContent -replace &#39;(?s)\r?\ndeleted\s*=\s*true&#39;, &quot;&quot;
+             Set-Content -Path $filePath -Value $newContent -Encoding UTF8 -NoNewline
+             Write-Host &quot;Unmarked: $($filePath | Split-Path -Leaf)&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+             return $true
+         } else {
+             Write-Host &quot;Not marked: $($filePath | Split-Path -Leaf)&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+             return $false
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ function GetArticleDate($filePath) {
+     $content = Get-Content $filePath -Raw
+     if ($content -match &#39;date\s*=\s*(\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})&#39;) {
+         return [DateTime]::ParseExact($matches[1], &quot;yyyy-MM-dd&quot;, $null)
+     }
+     return $null
+ }
+ 
+ if ($ListMarked) {
+     Write-Host &quot;Articles marked for deletion:&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+     Write-Host &quot;============================&#96;n&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+     
+     $markedCount = 0
+     Get-ChildItem -Path $contentPath -Filter &quot;*.md&quot; | ForEach-Object {
+         $content = Get-Content $_.FullName -Raw
+         if ($content -match &#39;deleted\s*=\s*true&#39;) {
+             $markedCount++
+             $date = GetArticleDate $_.FullName
+             $dateStr = if ($date) { $date.ToString(&quot;yyyy-MM-dd&quot;) } else { &quot;Unknown&quot; }
+             
+             $title = &quot;Untitled&quot;
+             if ($content -match &#39;title\s*=\s*&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;&#39;) {
+                 $title = $matches[1]
+             }
+             
+             Write-Host &quot;$markedCount. $dateStr - $title&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+             Write-Host &quot;   File: $($_.Name)&quot; -ForegroundColor DarkGray
+         }
+     }
+     
+     if ($markedCount -eq 0) {
+         Write-Host &quot;No articles marked for deletion.&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+     } else {
+         Write-Host &quot;&#96;nTotal marked: $markedCount&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+     }
+     exit
+ }
+ 
+ if ($FileName) {
+     $filePath = Join-Path $contentPath $FileName
+     if (Test-Path $filePath) {
+         MarkArticle $filePath (-not $Unmark) | Out-Null
+     } else {
+         Write-Error &quot;File not found: $filePath&quot;
+     }
+     exit
+ }
+ 
+ if ($DateBefore) {
+     $cutoffDate = [DateTime]::ParseExact($DateBefore, &quot;yyyy-MM-dd&quot;, $null)
+     Write-Host &quot;Marking articles before $DateBefore...&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+     
+     $count = 0
+     Get-ChildItem -Path $contentPath -Filter &quot;*.md&quot; | ForEach-Object {
+         $date = GetArticleDate $_.FullName
+         if ($date -and $date -lt $cutoffDate) {
+             if (MarkArticle $_.FullName $true) {
+                 $count++
+             }
+         }
+     }
+     Write-Host &quot;Marked $count articles for deletion.&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+     exit
+ }
+ 
+ if ($DateFrom -and $DateTo) {
+     $fromDate = [DateTime]::ParseExact($DateFrom, &quot;yyyy-MM-dd&quot;, $null)
+     $toDate = [DateTime]::ParseExact($DateTo, &quot;yyyy-MM-dd&quot;, $null)
+     Write-Host &quot;Marking articles from $DateFrom to $DateTo...&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+     
+     $count = 0
+     Get-ChildItem -Path $contentPath -Filter &quot;*.md&quot; | ForEach-Object {
+         $date = GetArticleDate $_.FullName
+         if ($date -and $date -ge $fromDate -and $date -le $toDate) {
+             if (MarkArticle $_.FullName $true) {
+                 $count++
+             }
+         }
+     }
+     Write-Host &quot;Marked $count articles for deletion.&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+     exit
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host @&quot;
+ Usage:
+   Mark single article:
+     .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -FileName &quot;article-name.md&quot;
+   
+   Mark articles before a date:
+     .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -DateBefore &quot;2021-01-01&quot;
+   
+   Mark articles in date range:
+     .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -DateFrom &quot;2020-01-01&quot; -DateTo &quot;2020-12-31&quot;
+   
+   Unmark an article:
+     .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -FileName &quot;article-name.md&quot; -Unmark
+   
+   List all marked articles:
+     .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -ListMarked
+ &quot;@
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,90 @@
- 
+ # Delete all articles marked with &quot;deleted: true&quot; in their front matter
+ # Usage: .\delete-marked-articles.ps1 [-WhatIf] [-Backup]
+ 
+ param(
+     [switch]$WhatIf,
+     [switch]$Backup
+ )
+ 
+ $contentPath = &quot;content\posts&quot;
+ $backupPath = &quot;content\posts\_backup_$(Get-Date -Format &#39;yyyyMMdd_HHmmss&#39;)&quot;
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;Scanning for articles marked for deletion...&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ 
+ $markedArticles = @()
+ Get-ChildItem -Path $contentPath -Filter &quot;*.md&quot; | ForEach-Object {
+     $content = Get-Content $_.FullName -Raw
+     if ($content -match &#39;deleted\s*=\s*true&#39;) {
+         $date = &quot;Unknown&quot;
+         if ($content -match &#39;date\s*=\s*(\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})&#39;) {
+             $date = $matches[1]
+         }
+         
+         $title = &quot;Untitled&quot;
+         if ($content -match &#39;title\s*=\s*&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;&#39;) {
+             $title = $matches[1]
+         }
+         
+         $markedArticles += [PSCustomObject]@{
+             File = $_
+             Date = $date
+             Title = $title
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ if ($markedArticles.Count -eq 0) {
+     Write-Host &quot;No articles marked for deletion.&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+     exit
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;nFound $($markedArticles.Count) articles marked for deletion:&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+ Write-Host &quot;========================================&#96;n&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+ 
+ $count = 0
+ foreach ($article in $markedArticles) {
+     $count++
+     Write-Host &quot;$count. $($article.Date) - $($article.Title)&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+     Write-Host &quot;   File: $($article.File.Name)&quot; -ForegroundColor DarkGray
+ }
+ 
+ if ($WhatIf) {
+     Write-Host &quot;&#96;n[WHAT IF MODE] - No files will be deleted.&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+     exit
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;nWARNING: This will permanently delete $($markedArticles.Count) articles!&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+ $confirm = Read-Host &quot;Type &#39;DELETE&#39; to confirm deletion&quot;
+ 
+ if ($confirm -ne &quot;DELETE&quot;) {
+     Write-Host &quot;Deletion cancelled.&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow
+     exit
+ }
+ 
+ if ($Backup) {
+     Write-Host &quot;&#96;nCreating backup in: $backupPath&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $backupPath -Force | Out-Null
+     
+     foreach ($article in $markedArticles) {
+         Copy-Item -Path $article.File.FullName -Destination (Join-Path $backupPath $article.File.Name)
+     }
+     Write-Host &quot;Backup created.&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;nDeleting articles...&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+ $deletedCount = 0
+ foreach ($article in $markedArticles) {
+     try {
+         Remove-Item -Path $article.File.FullName -Force
+         Write-Host &quot;Deleted: $($article.File.Name)&quot; -ForegroundColor Red
+         $deletedCount++
+     } catch {
+         Write-Error &quot;Failed to delete: $($article.File.Name) - $_&quot;
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ Write-Host &quot;&#96;nDeleted $deletedCount of $($markedArticles.Count) articles.&quot; -ForegroundColor Green
+ if ($Backup) {
+     Write-Host &quot;Backup saved to: $backupPath&quot; -ForegroundColor Cyan
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
          {{ if $sortedPosts }}
          &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Oldest Article:&lt;/strong&gt; {{ (index $sortedPosts 0).Date.Format &quot;January 2, 2006&quot; }}&lt;/p&gt;
```

Creating a quick reference guide:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: ARTICLE-DELETION-GUIDE.md</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 138, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,138 @@
- 
+ # Article Deletion Guide
+ 
+ This guide explains how to mark and delete articles in your Hugo site.
+ 
+ ## Overview
+ 
+ The system uses a &#96;deleted: true&#96; field in the front matter of markdown files to mark articles for deletion. This allows you to:
+ - Review what&#39;s marked before deleting
+ - Unmark articles if needed
+ - See marked articles in both the web interface and scripts
+ 
+ ## Scripts
+ 
+ ### 1. List Articles by Date
+ View all articles sorted by date (oldest first), with deletion status highlighted.
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ .\list-articles-by-date.ps1
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Features:**
+ - Shows all articles sorted by date (oldest first)
+ - Highlights articles marked for deletion in red
+ - Shows draft status
+ - Displays file paths for easy reference
+ 
+ ### 2. Mark Articles for Deletion
+ 
+ #### Mark a single article:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -FileName &quot;article-name.md&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### Mark all articles before a specific date:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -DateBefore &quot;2021-01-01&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### Mark articles in a date range:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -DateFrom &quot;2020-01-01&quot; -DateTo &quot;2020-12-31&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### List all marked articles:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -ListMarked
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### Unmark an article:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -FileName &quot;article-name.md&quot; -Unmark
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 3. Delete Marked Articles
+ 
+ **⚠️ WARNING: This permanently deletes files!**
+ 
+ #### Preview what will be deleted (dry run):
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ .\delete-marked-articles.ps1 -WhatIf
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### Delete with backup:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ .\delete-marked-articles.ps1 -Backup
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ #### Delete without backup:
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+ .\delete-marked-articles.ps1
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Safety features:**
+ - Shows list of articles to be deleted
+ - Requires typing &quot;DELETE&quot; to confirm
+ - Optional backup to &#96;content/posts/_backup_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS/&#96;
+ 
+ ## Web Interface
+ 
+ Visit &#96;/articles-by-date/&#96; in your browser to see:
+ - All articles sorted by date (oldest first)
+ - Visual indicators for articles marked for deletion (red border and badge)
+ - File paths for each article
+ - Summary statistics
+ 
+ ## Workflow Example
+ 
+ 1. **Review articles:**
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+    .\list-articles-by-date.ps1
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 2. **Mark articles before 2021:**
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+    .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -DateBefore &quot;2021-01-01&quot;
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 3. **Review what&#39;s marked:**
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+    .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -ListMarked
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+    Or visit &#96;/articles-by-date/&#96; in your browser
+ 
+ 4. **Unmark any articles you want to keep:**
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+    .\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -FileName &quot;article-to-keep.md&quot; -Unmark
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 5. **Preview deletion (optional):**
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+    .\delete-marked-articles.ps1 -WhatIf
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 6. **Delete with backup:**
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;powershell
+    .\delete-marked-articles.ps1 -Backup
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Manual Marking
+ 
+ You can also manually add &#96;deleted = true&#96; to any article&#39;s front matter:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;markdown
+ +++
+ title = &quot;Article Title&quot;
+ date = 2020-01-01T00:00:00Z
+ draft = false
+ deleted = true
+ +++
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Notes
+ 
+ - Marked articles are still visible in the site until you run the delete script
+ - The &#96;deleted&#96; field is only used for marking - it doesn&#39;t automatically hide articles
+ - Always use &#96;-Backup&#96; when deleting to be safe
+ - The backup folder is created in &#96;content/posts/_backup_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS/&#96;
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---


Created a system for marking articles for deletion. Here's what's included:

## What I created

### 1. **Marking script** (`mark-article-for-deletion.ps1`)
   - Mark individual articles by filename
   - Mark all articles before a specific date
   - Mark articles in a date range
   - List all marked articles
   - Unmark articles if needed

### 2. **Deletion script** (`delete-marked-articles.ps1`)
   - Shows what will be deleted
   - Requires confirmation (type "DELETE")
   - Optional backup before deletion
   - Safe deletion with preview

### 3. **Updated listing script** (`list-articles-by-date.ps1`)
   - Highlights marked articles in red
   - Shows deletion status
   - Displays summary with count of marked articles

### 4. **Web interface** (`/articles-by-date/`)
   - Visual indicators (red border and badge) for marked articles
   - Shows all articles sorted by date
   - Summary statistics

### 5. **Guide** (`ARTICLE-DELETION-GUIDE.md`)
   - Documentation on how to use everything

## Quick start

**Mark all articles before 2021:**
```powershell
.\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -DateBefore "2021-01-01"
```

**See what's marked:**
```powershell
.\mark-article-for-deletion.ps1 -ListMarked
```

**Delete all marked articles (with backup):**
```powershell
.\delete-marked-articles.ps1 -Backup
```

The system adds `deleted = true` to the front matter of articles you mark, so you can review before deleting. Marked articles appear in red in both the script output and the web page.

```diff
+                 disabled&gt;
+             Generate Deletion Script
+         &lt;/button&gt;
+         &lt;div id=&quot;script-output&quot; style=&quot;margin-top: 20px; display: none;&quot;&gt;
+             &lt;textarea id=&quot;script-content&quot; 
+                       readonly 
+                       style=&quot;width: 100%; min-height: 200px; padding: 10px; font-family: &#39;Courier New&#39;, monospace; font-size: 12px; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 4px; background: white;&quot;&gt;&lt;/textarea&gt;
+             &lt;button id=&quot;download-script&quot; 
+                     style=&quot;margin-top: 10px; padding: 8px 16px; background: #28a745; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 4px; cursor: pointer;&quot;&gt;
+                 Download Script
+             &lt;/button&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+     
+     &lt;div style=&quot;margin-top: 20px; padding: 15px; background: #f8d7da; border: 1px solid #dc3545; border-radius: 4px;&quot;&gt;
+         &lt;strong&gt;⚠️ Warning:&lt;/strong&gt; This will permanently delete the selected articles. Make sure you have backups if needed.
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+ &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+ &lt;script&gt;
+ (function() {
+     const checkboxes = document.querySelectorAll(&#39;.article-checkbox&#39;);
+     const selectAllBtn = document.getElementById(&#39;select-all&#39;);
+     const selectNoneBtn = document.getElementById(&#39;select-none&#39;);
+     const selectedCount = document.getElementById(&#39;selected-count&#39;);
+     const generateBtn = document.getElementById(&#39;generate-script&#39;);
+     const scriptOutput = document.getElementById(&#39;script-output&#39;);
+     const scriptContent = document.getElementById(&#39;script-content&#39;);
+     const downloadBtn = document.getElementById(&#39;download-script&#39;);
+     
+     function updateCount() {
+         const checked = document.querySelectorAll(&#39;.article-checkbox:checked&#39;).length;
+         selectedCount.textContent = checked + &#39; selected&#39;;
+         generateBtn.disabled = checked === 0;
+     }
+     
+     checkboxes.forEach(cb =&gt; {
+         cb.addEventListener(&#39;change&#39;, updateCount);
+     });
+     
+     selectAllBtn.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, function() {
+         checkboxes.forEach(cb =&gt; cb.checked = true);
+         updateCount();
+     });
+     
+     selectNoneBtn.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, function() {
+         checkboxes.forEach(cb =&gt; cb.checked = false);
+         updateCount();
+     });
+     
+     generateBtn.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, function() {
+         const selected = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll(&#39;.article-checkbox:checked&#39;));
+         
+         if (selected.length === 0) {
+             alert(&#39;Please select at least one article.&#39;);
+             return;
+         }
+         
+         let script = &#39;# Script to mark selected articles for deletion\n&#39;;
+         script += &#39;# Generated: &#39; + new Date().toLocaleString() + &#39;\n&#39;;
+         script += &#39;# Total articles: &#39; + selected.length + &#39;\n\n&#39;;
+         script += &#39;$contentPath = &quot;content\\posts&quot;\n\n&#39;;
+         
+         selected.forEach((cb, index) =&gt; {
+             const filename = cb.getAttribute(&#39;data-filename&#39;);
+             const title = cb.getAttribute(&#39;data-title&#39;);
+             const date = cb.getAttribute(&#39;data-date&#39;);
+             
+             script += &#96;# ${index + 1}. ${title} (${date})\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;$filePath = Join-Path $contentPath &quot;${filename}&quot;\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;if (Test-Path $filePath) {\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;    $content = Get-Content $filePath -Raw -Encoding UTF8\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;    if ($content -notmatch &#39;deleted\\s*=\\s*true&#39;) {\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;        if ($content -match &#39;(?s)(\\+\\+\\+.*?)(draft\\s*=\\s*[^\\r\\n]+)&#39;) {\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;            $newContent = $content -replace &#39;(?s)(\\+\\+\\+.*?)(draft\\s*=\\s*[^\\r\\n]+)&#39;, &quot;&#96;$1&#96;$2&#96;r&#96;ndeleted = true&quot;\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;        } elseif ($content -match &#39;(?s)(\\+\\+\\+.*?)(\\+\\+\\+)&#39;) {\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;            $newContent = $content -replace &#39;(?s)(\\+\\+\\+.*?)(\\+\\+\\+)&#39;, &quot;&#96;$1deleted = true&#96;r&#96;n&#96;$2&quot;\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;        } else {\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;            Write-Warning &quot;Could not parse front matter in: $filePath&quot;\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;            continue\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;        }\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;        Set-Content -Path $filePath -Value $newContent -Encoding UTF8 -NoNewline\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;        Write-Host &quot;Marked for deletion: ${filename}&quot; -ForegroundColor Red\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;    } else {\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;        Write-Host &quot;Already marked: ${filename}&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;    }\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;} else {\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;    Write-Warning &quot;File not found: $filePath&quot;\n&#96;;
+             script += &#96;}\n\n&#96;;
+         });
+         
+         script += &#39;Write-Host &quot;&#96;nMarked &#39; + selected.length + &#39; articles for deletion.&quot; -ForegroundColor Green\n&#39;;
+         script += &#39;Write-Host &quot;Run .\\delete-marked-articles.ps1 to delete them permanently.&quot; -ForegroundColor Yellow\n&#39;;
+         
+         scriptContent.value = script;
+         scriptOutput.style.display = &#39;block&#39;;
+         scriptOutput.scrollIntoView({ behavior: &#39;smooth&#39;, block: &#39;nearest&#39; });
+     });
+     
+     downloadBtn.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, function() {
+         const blob = new Blob([scriptContent.value], { type: &#39;text/plain&#39; });
+         const url = URL.createObjectURL(blob);
+         const a = document.createElement(&#39;a&#39;);
+         a.href = url;
+         a.download = &#39;mark-articles-for-deletion.ps1&#39;;
+         document.body.appendChild(a);
+         a.click();
+         document.body.removeChild(a);
+         URL.revokeObjectURL(url);
+     });
+     
+     updateCount();
+ })();
+ &lt;/script&gt;
+ 
+ &lt;style&gt;
+ .post-item:hover {
+     background: #f8f9fa !important;
+ }
+ 
+ .article-checkbox:checked + div h2 {
+     text-decoration: line-through;
+     opacity: 0.7;
+ }
+ &lt;/style&gt;
+ {{ end }}
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

Created a web interface. Visit `/delete-articles/` in your browser to see:

1. **List of all articles before 2021** — sorted by date (oldest first)
2. **Checkbox for each article** — select which ones to delete
3. **Select All / Select None buttons** — for bulk selection
4. **Generate Script button** — creates a PowerShell script for the selected articles
5. **Download button** — downloads the script to run locally

The interface:
- Shows article title, date, and filename
- Highlights selected count
- Generates a script that marks selected articles for deletion
- Provides a download link for the script

After downloading the script, run it to mark the articles. Then use `delete-marked-articles.ps1` to permanently delete them.

The page is ready. Rebuild your Hugo site and visit `/delete-articles/` to use it.

Hugo is now at `C:\Users\spark\bin\hugo.exe` and added to your PATH permanently. The server is starting.

**Important:** Restart PowerShell for the PATH change to take effect in new sessions. In the current session, the `hugo` command won't work until you restart.

The server is running. Access your delete articles page at:

**http://localhost:1313/delete-articles/**

After restarting PowerShell, you can use `hugo` directly.
